venue.address_2: Look for High St and Glencliff home for the elderly
venue.name: Glencliff Trail

item.description:
We will be hiking to the summit of Mt. Moosilauke via the Glencliff Trail.

All hikers must read, understand and agree to the liability/responsibility. waiver as outlined on this website.

All attendees must have prior winter hiking experience and be able to maintain a two mile per hour pace for a minimum of four hours without a break.

Starting at Glencliff Trailhead

Back to here hike 0.40 mi/17 min/+183 ft on the Glencliff Trail
The trail leaves the road, passes a gate and enters a pasture, and soon crosses a small brook on a bridge. It joins a farm road that ascends from the parking area, then crosses a brook, follows a cart track along the left edge of a field, and enters the woods, where the Hurricane Trail immediately diverges right (east).
to the junction of Hurricane Trail
hike 2.60 mi/2 hr 42 min/+2785 ft on the Glencliff Trail
The Glencliff Trail ascends moderately on a logging road that gradually fades away, crosses several small brooks, and passes a restricted outlook from a blowdown patch. Soon the trail swings right, going straight up the slope, and it becomes quite steep, passing a talus slope that offers good views to the west. At the top of the ridge, it levels and reaches the junction with a spur path (sign) that leads right, to the open summit of South Peak. In a few more steps, it enters the Moosilauke Carriage Rd.; for the summit, turn left.
to the junction of Moosilauke Carriage Road and South Peak, Mt Moosilauke spur
hike 0.90 mi/38 min/+344 ft on the Moosilauke Carriage Road
Then the Glencliff Trail enters from the left; a few steps along the Glencliff Trail, a spur trail leads left to South Peak, a fine viewpoint. The old road, now part of the AT, continues along the ridge, with a narrow fringe of trees on each side. Then it reaches the treeline and ascends the windswept ridge to the summit.
to Mt Moosilauke

Totals
Distance 3.90 mi
Time 3 hr 37 min
Elev Gain +3348 ft
Elev Loss -36 ft
Elev Change +3312 ft

Driving Directions
Show in Google Earth
Download to GPS

Back to here hike 0.90 mi/38 min/-344 ft on the Moosilauke Carriage Road
The Moosilauke Carriage Road starts at the summit of Moosilauke and descends the windswept ridge down to treeline. It continues on an old road, now part of the AT, along the ridge, with a narrow fringe of trees on each side. It then reaches the Glencliff Trail which diverges to the right. A few steps along the Glencliff Trail, a spur trail leads left to South Peak, a fine viewpoint.
to the junction of Glencliff Trail and South Peak, Mt Moosilauke spur
hike 2.60 mi/2 hr 42 min/-2785 ft on the Glencliff Trail
From the Carriage Road, just below South Peak, the Glencliff Trail begins. A spur path (sign) leads to the open summit of South Peak. The Glencliff trail leaves the ridge passing a talus slope that offers good views to the west, descending quite steeply. It then swings right and descends straight down the slope. It passes a restricted outlook from a blowdown patch, crosses several small brooks and begins to descend along an old logging road.
to the junction of Hurricane Trail
hike 0.40 mi/17 min/-183 ft on the Glencliff Trail
The Hurricane Trail diverges to the left (southeast) and the trail then leaves the woods and follows a cart track along the right edge of an open field. It crosses a brook and joins a farm road that descends toward the parking area. It crosses a small brook on a bridge, enters a pasture, and passes through a gate at the road.
to Glencliff Trailhead

Totals
Distance 7.80 mi
Time 7 hr 14 min
Elev Gain +3384 ft
Elev Loss -3384 ft
Elev Change 0 ft

Driving Directions
Show in Google Earth
Download to GPS
item.how_to_find_us: Dianne and I will be in a black four door Echo with Maine plates.
item.name: Mt Moosilauke via Glencliff Trail
